TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlAuthenticationStatement extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement

Docs.summary: Represents a claim for a security token that asserts that the subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify when the subject was authenticated. The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements. The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement>. A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> asserts that the statement's subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: A that represents the subject of the claim.
A URI reference that specifies how the subject was authenticated.
A that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
An of type that contains additional information about the subject.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified authentication details.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.
|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified|
When the `authenticationMethod` parameter is `null`, the authentication method is set to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddClaimsToList(class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> claims) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub AddClaimsToList (claims As IList(Of Claim))

Docs.param: An of type that contains the set of claims to add to.
Docs.summary: Adds a claim based on the properties of this instance to the specified collection of claims.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AddClaimsToList%28System.Collections.Generic.IList%7BSystem.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim%7D%29> method adds a claim to the `claims` parameter based on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthorityBindings%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.ClaimType%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IPAddress%2A>, and properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime AuthenticationInstant { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };
member this.AuthenticationInstant : DateTime with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
Docs.value:
A that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
Exception type
Condition
The property is set and the property is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The time is stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A> property corresponds to the `AuthenticationInstant` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AuthenticationMethod { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AuthenticationMethod : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the method used to authenticate the subject.
Docs.value: The method used to authenticate the subject. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.
|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified|
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A> property is set to `null`, the authentication method is set to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified`.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A> property corresponds to the `AuthenticationMethod` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.exception: The property is set and the property is .
